title: 106_s2821
content: The Act may be cited as the "FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000". It addresses the creditability of service. The "FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000" amends Section 8411(b) of title 5, United States Code to include service as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation between December 31, 1988, and June 30, 2000, as creditable for purposes of this chapter. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000 allows service as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation between December 31, 1988, and June 30, 2000, to be credited for retirement purposes under this chapter. An employee or Member performing service subject to this chapter must deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for such service into the Fund. An employee or Member must deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for service described in subsection (b)(6) into the Fund within 5 years of becoming an employee or Member. An employee or Member must deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for service described in subsection (b)(6) into the Fund within 5 years of becoming an employee or Member. Any deposit made more than 5 years after the specified dates shall include interest, computed and compounded annually. If the deposit is not made in full, interest will accrue. The deposit for temporary or intermittent service must include interest, computed annually and compounded starting from the end of the 5-year period. Failure to make the full deposit will result in a reduction of any annuity based on the service. PROVISIONS RELATING TO PERSONS WHO HAVE SEPARATED. The Office of Personnel Management will establish regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service. Credit will only be given if a written application is submitted by December 31, 2001, as required by the regulations. Any annuity or survivor annuity payable at the time of application submission may be recomputed. Any annuity or survivor annuity payable at the time of application submission may be recomputed to include service described in section 8411(b)(6) of title 5, effective for amounts accruing after 30 days from the application date. Any annuity or survivor annuity may be recomputed to include service described in section 8411(b)(6) of title 5, effective for amounts accruing after 30 days from the application date. If the full deposit required under section 8411(j) of title 5 is not timely made, an appropriate condition applies. If the full deposit required under section 8411(j) of title 5 is not timely made, a reduction will be made in the recomputed annuity in accordance with the regulations. Interest is not included in the deposit. SEC. 4. NOTIFICATION AND OTHER DUTIES OF THE OFFICE OF PERSONNEL MANAGEMENT. The Office of Personnel Management will inform individuals of their rights under the Act and assist in obtaining necessary information from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation will provide necessary information to verify an individual's entitlement to service credits or annuity recomputation under the Act.
